wine isn't a virtual machine.  It's an emulation of the windows API/ABI

virtualbox is a virtual machine
vbox is another name for virtualbox

it's different from a dualboot
a true dualboot doesn't use any emulation and runs directly on the actual hardware

virtualbox is fairly easy to use
1 more thing, whats is the benefit of using vm?
things that run in a vm don't have full hardware access and don't need to be installed on a hard disk partition
plus some virtual machines, like qemu, support other architectures, like mips or sparc
